titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Time Inc. Library and Archives Records
1923-2013, undated
MS 3009-RG 30
titlestmt.author: Holly Deakyne, Samantha Brown, Melanie Rinehart
titlestmt.sponsor: The processing of the Time Inc. Records was made possible by a generous grant from the Henry Luce Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-05-25 10:05:15 -0400.

did.unittitle: Time Inc. Library and Archives Records
did.abstract: The Time Inc. Library and Archives Records contain the Library Reference Collection which includes annual reports, press clippings, and Time covers.
did.physloc: Materials in this collection are stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation Note
prefercite.p: This record group should be cited as Time Inc. Library and Archives Records (MS 3009-RG 20), The New-York Historical Society.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials Note
relatedmaterial.p: This finding aid relates to just one record group of the Time Inc. Records. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the Time Inc. Records (MS 3009). The Henry Luce Papers (MS 3014) were acquired with the Time Inc. Records. The collection of books acquired with the records are cataloged as the Time Inc. Reference Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: Series I. Library Reference Collection was processed by Holly Deakyne, Samantha Brown, and Melanie Rinhart in 2016 and 2017. Deakyne housed and rearranged the Annual Reports. Brown housed and rearranged the Press Clippings. Rinehart transferred the Time Covers into new archival containers. Deakyne, Brown, and Rinehart created the inventory and other descriptive notes to produce this finding aid.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: This collection is owned by the New-York Historical Society. Although the N-YHS owns this collection as physical property, the donor specifically retains all copyright and all other proprietary rights which may exist. The copyright law of the United States governs the making of photocopies and protects unpublished materials as well as published materials. Unpublished materials created before January 1, 1978 cannot be quoted in publication without permission of the copyright holder.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open to qualified researchers.Materials in this collection are stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: The record group is currently organized in one series, with additional series expected as future accruals are received and processed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The Time Inc. Library and Archives Records contains the Library Reference Collection comprising reference material assembled by the Library and Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals Note
accruals.p: Further additions to this finding aid are expected.

Library resources
Publishers and publishing -- New York (State) -- New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The Library Reference Collection contains reference material assembled by the Time Inc. Library and Archives including a run of annual reports, printouts of press clippings emailed to staff by Time Inc.'s corporate communications, and a run of Time covers.
